title: Aligning Infinity
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2WpgF1b

by WaxRhapsodic

The Ancient One was very clear. Without the Infinity Stones the Universe will fall into chaos and destruction. How will our remaining heroes save a universe coming apart at the seams?

Words: 5471, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 4 of Endgame Re-Imagined

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types, The Avengers - Ambiguous Fandom, Spider-Man - All Media Types, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Spider-Man/Deadpool - Joe Kelly (Comics), Deadpool - All Media Types, Deadpool (Movieverse), Doctor Strange (2016), Thor (Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Morgan Stark (Marvel Cinematic Universe), Thor (Marvel), Loki (Marvel), Dr. Strange, Wade Wilson, Eitri (Marvel)
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Pepper Potts, Peter Parker/Wade Wilson, Spider-Man/Deadpool
  • Additional Tags: Tony Stark Has A Heart, Parent Tony Stark, Adoption, Adopted Sibling Relationship, Adopted Children, Falling In Love, Friendship, Friendship/Love, Best Friends, Friends to Lovers, Post-Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Not Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Compliant, Canon Divergence - Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Post-Endgame, Not Steve Friendly, not team Cap friendly, Steve Rogers is Not Captain America

summary:
Tony: made you some tea
Stephen: oh thanks *drinks some of it*....:/  What kind of tea is this?
Tony: Oh, I just boiled some...
body:
Tony: made you some tea
Stephen: oh thanks *drinks some of it*....:/  What kind of tea is this?
Tony: Oh, I just boiled some Gatorade.
Stephen: ....*continues drinking it*

dialogue.name: Stephen
dialogue.label: Stephen:
dialogue.phrase: oh thanks *drinks some of it*....:/  What kind of tea is this?

dialogue.name: Tony
dialogue.label: Tony:
dialogue.phrase: Oh, I just boiled some Gatorade.

summary: Ironstrange Sleeping Beauty AU. Tony is the king, Stephen is one of the fairy godfathers (alongside Mordo and Wong). After his...
question: Ironstrange Sleeping Beauty AU. Tony is the king, Stephen is one of the fairy godfathers (alongside Mordo and Wong). After his only child (Peter's mother died on childbirth) got cursed to die on his 17th birthday at the Palace, Tony trusted his child in Stephen, Mordo and Wong. Of course, he goes to visit every year his "bastard" (something that infuriates his actual husband, Steve), which makes Stephen fall in love with him (Tony loves Stephen too but he tries not to show it shhh)
answer:
(I accidentally closed all my tabs and lost what I was going to say, and I am SO annoyed, but onward and upward, I guess)

first of all:

the colors match

(someone with photoshop … you know)

HEADCANONS:

  • Stephen didn’t think he would care for Peter as much as he does, but the boy is like his own son
  • Stephen tries to be strict, but he’s secretly the fun dad
  • Wong and Mordo are slightly more strict, but really, no one can resist Peter’s puppy dog eyes. All are weak to him. 
  • Peter even puppy-eyes them into teaching him some magic
  • Tony visits as often as he can
  • Stephen is the closest to Peter, so when Tony comes by, they spend a lot of time together
  • At first they don’t get along - Tony is jealous that Stephen is so close to his son, whereas Stephen is threatened by Tony’s position as Peter’s bio dad - but they eventually bond over Peter
  • then
  • P I N I N G
  • Peter knows they love each other and tries to get them together
  • Wong and Mordo are laughing their asses off at this
  • Peter finally tricks them into having a romantic fireplace-lit dinner
  • And it’s SO OBVIOUS they love each other
  • And they admit it’s obvious
  • But they’re nervous
  • But they just can’t take it anymore
  • They KISS
  • Tony feels guilty because he’s married and can’t easily get a divorce
  • Stephen is like “lol fuck stove”
  • but not the way he’s fucking Tony
  • through unforseen circumstances, Peter does die at the palace, but Stephen brings him back with the time stone and idk, the power of love
  • then stuff happens, and Stephen and Tony get married
  • just ignore Steve
  • imagine him sulking in the background

tags: u definitely dont want a whole essay
summary: Robert Downey Jr. is Tony Stark. Though I appreciate RDJ as being his own, separate person from his character, Tony Stark, the...
body: Robert Downey Jr. is Tony Stark. Though I appreciate RDJ as being his own, separate person from his character, Tony Stark, the ways in which both personas have drastically impacted the world, both separately and in tandem, is incredible. Not only are they both prepared to use their wealth to push for better technology to improve the state of the world, but both are very selfless and have grown to be inspiring people, not just despite - but because of - their less than perfect backgrounds. In this essay, I will—

i love tony, i really do and i know he’s kinda the main representative of the mcu but here’s my problem 
it just really salts my...
body:
i love tony, i really do and i know he’s kinda the main representative of the mcu but here’s my problem

it just really salts my apples that neither natasha nor loki ever get mentioned after their deaths while tony gets a funeral scene and you get to see how impactful his death is (and spiderman ffh will even touch on this further).

(not going to add gamora bc I’m pretty sure we got to see how her death affected quill and it seems like gotg 3 will go more into that anyway)

natasha sacrificed herself on vormir to save the world, loki gave up the tesseract so his brother would live.

and i understand that tony’s sacrifice was way more significant but still

those two did extraordinary things and im sad they aren’t getting the attention they deserve.

title: So Many [Prop-Tony] Tropes, So Little Time
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2IzhFeq

by Gibbs_yeah

Here we are in the Endgame, and the Tony tropes are as stupid as ever. Let’s look at a few.

Series: Part 4 of To Trope or Not to Trope

title: I just wanted to be a hero
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2wFHROM

by ScarletPotter

Steve Rogers has a rough day. Peter Rogers misses his curfew.

Steve gets angry and says things that he shouldn’t say.

Words: 1506, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 7 of Avengers Oneshots

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types, Marvel Cinematic Universe, Marvel
  • Rating: General Audiences

blog.name: cas-kingdom
blog.title: hi my names traumatised and im a victim of endgame
blog.description:
hey there!! welcome to my blog. i write fics, imagines, am in way too many fandoms, and love hugh jackman with all my heart. do NOT follow me if your blog is nsfw. I’M NOT ACCEPTING PROMPTS. thank you. if you're on mobile, here's where you'll find my masterpost:

cas-kingdom.tumblr.com/masterpost

summary: Tony/ reader any number- not romantic -- ( sorry I know, not helpful but I love everything soo. Love you💕😍
question: Tony/ reader any number- not romantic -- ( sorry I know, not helpful but I love everything soo. Love you💕😍
answer:
You tried your very hardest to act like everything was alright, but, really, who in their right mind could agree that it was? Thanos had snapped his fingers, and half of the world had disappeared. Of course, it was only fair that everyone remaining attempt to carry on with their lives and not dwell on everything that apparently could not be undone, but it still sometimes made people stop and think for a moment about everything they’d lost.

The Avengers used to host parties as often as they could. Now, the possibility of that happening was almost zero percent. Not only did the number of guests they were able to invite halve, and the amount of fun everyone possessed the ability to have lower significantly… they’d all split up. Sure, most of them still lived in the Facility, but Tony had long since moved out to build his house in the countryside with Pepper and the new baby, and that alone was enough to make it feel as though the Avengers were no more. Nobody had heard anything from Clint - was it even right to assume he was still here? - and Bruce kept to himself, whether at the new job he’d weirdly taken on or in the lab Tony had abandoned… the only people you really felt as though things were the same with was your brother - Steve - and Nat. 

Nevertheless, any opportunity given where everyone could get back together and have a relatively good time was taken in amazing stride. Morgan Stark’s christening seemed to be a good opportunity. For the first time in a long time, everyone was together, and everyone was happy. Morgan was the greatest example of something good that could come out of this new world.

And, yet, it all seemed a little intense. By the time the guests had driven back to Tony’s house from the church and the Christening Party began, all the drinks and laughing and music and such simply felt like… too much. So, you’d isolated yourself in the spare room, sitting on the bed, knees up and tucked into your chest, chin resting on top. Just thinking. About Wanda, about Vision, about Nick, Sam, Bucky… everyone you’d lost. None of them knew that Tony had a daughter. None of them were here to celebrate. And it all felt so wrong.

You could still hear everyone downstairs. They sounded happy. You wanted to be happy. But it felt almost impossible right now.

You weren’t expecting the door to open and for none other than Tony to walk in. He looked at you for a moment, as if analyzing whether or not you wanted his company, before walking in and shutting the door behind him. “Hey, munchkin,” he said, a soft smile appearing on his lips, “everything okay?”

A nod was all he received to that. Sighing, he walked over to the bed and sat himself next to you, immediately wrapping an arm around your shoulders and pulling you into his side. No resistance from you told him all he needed to know. “A little overwhelmed?” He turned his head down to peer at you.

“A little.”

“It is quiet up here.”

“I know.”

It was silent for a moment, the only sound being the muffled voices from downstairs, before he spoke again. “I think Morgan misses you.”

You breathed a small laugh. “She has loads of people to entertain her down there.”

“Yeah, I know… but, she wants her Aunt Y/N.” He rubbed your arm and pressed a kiss to the top of your head. “And, personally, I’d like you to come down with me, too. This is the first time in a long time we’ve all been together…”

You heaved a sigh, turning your face slightly to half-bury into his blazer. “That’s the thing…” you said, squeezing your eyes shut. “There’s so many of us missing.”

Tony didn’t have much of a response to that. It was definitely true. Everyone felt it. He, especially, had had difficulty adjusting to it all after losing Peter… but, through Morgan. and through you and the rest of his family and friends, he’d learnt to bypass everything that had happened and focus on the present. Maybe, one day, something would come up in which they could take back what they’d lost, but, for now, it was all they could do to live each day as it came. “It sucks, bear,” he said, voice quiet. “It sucks ass, and we all know it. All of us have lost people, and we’d give anything to have them back, but that… that just isn’t possible, right now. And that’s coming from me.” He paused for a moment, leaning his head against yours. “It’s okay to feel like this. Hell, not a day goes by when there’s not a few moments where I’ll sit in silence and feel exactly like this… but, I’m trying my best. We all are. I know you are, too.”

You nodded against his chest. “I am. But it’s hard.”

“It is. Probably one of the hardest things all of us will ever have to go through. But, as long as we’ve all got each other, that crazy purple psycho can’t hurt us anymore. We’re trying to show him here that what he did isn’t gonna stop us from living. He tried to tear us down, but there isn’t a chance in hell he’ll succeed.” You moved your head to peer up at him, and he smiled. “I’ve got you, you’ve got me… and that’s all that matters. We’re all together.”

It took less than a second for you to mirror his almost melancholy smile, tears pricking at your eyes, but not falling. “I guess so,” you said, and he poked your said.

“Do more than guess, kiddo. The future’s in our hands. We’ll only make it what we’re able to.”

“Tony? Y/N? We’re cutting the cake! Where are you?” Rhodey’s voice carried up the stairs and into the room. Tony glanced briefly at the door before turning back to you.

“We should head back to the party,” you said, and the man leaned down to press a kiss to your forehead, tucking a strand of hair behind your ear.

“Come on, then, you.” He grasped your hand in his and you took a deep breath in before following him in standing to your feet and walking towards the door.

As long as you had each other, he couldn’t hurt you anymore.

If only that had been true.

Nobody had heard anything from Clint - was it even right to assume he was still here? - and Bruce kept to himself, whether at the new job he’d weirdly taken on or in the lab Tony had abandoned… the only people you really felt as though things were the same with was your brother - Steve - and Nat. 

Nevertheless, any opportunity given where everyone could get back together and have a relatively good time was taken in amazing stride. Morgan Stark’s christening seemed to be a good opportunity. For the first time in a long time, everyone was together, and everyone was happy. Morgan was the greatest example of something good that could come out of this new world.

And, yet, it all seemed a little intense. By the time the guests had driven back to Tony’s house from the church and the Christening Party began, all the drinks and laughing and music and such simply felt like… too much. So, you’d isolated yourself in the spare room, sitting on the bed, knees up and tucked into your chest, chin resting on top. Just thinking. About Wanda, about Vision, about Nick, Sam, Bucky… everyone you’d lost. None of them knew that Tony had a daughter. None of them were here to celebrate. And it all felt so wrong.

You could still hear everyone downstairs. They sounded happy. You wanted to be happy. But it felt almost impossible right now.

You weren’t expecting the door to open and for none other than Tony to walk in. He looked at you for a moment, as if analyzing whether or not you wanted his company, before walking in and shutting the door behind him. “Hey, munchkin,” he said, a soft smile appearing on his lips, “everything okay?”

A nod was all he received to that. Sighing, he walked over to the bed and sat himself next to you, immediately wrapping an arm around your shoulders and pulling you into his side. No resistance from you told him all he needed to know. “A little overwhelmed?” He turned his head down to peer at you.

“A little.”

“It is quiet up here.”

“I know.”

It was silent for a moment, the only sound being the muffled voices from downstairs, before he spoke again. “I think Morgan misses you.”

You breathed a small laugh. “She has loads of people to entertain her down there.”

“Yeah, I know… but, she wants her Aunt Y/N.” He rubbed your arm and pressed a kiss to the top of your head. “And, personally, I’d like you to come down with me, too. This is the first time in a long time we’ve all been together…”

You heaved a sigh, turning your face slightly to half-bury into his blazer. “That’s the thing…” you said, squeezing your eyes shut. “There’s so many of us missing.”

Tony didn’t have much of a response to that. It was definitely true. Everyone felt it. He, especially, had had difficulty adjusting to it all after losing Peter… but, through Morgan. and through you and the rest of his family and friends, he’d learnt to bypass everything that had happened and focus on the present. Maybe, one day, something would come up in which they could take back what they’d lost, but, for now, it was all they could do to live each day as it came. “It sucks, bear,” he said, voice quiet. “It sucks ass, and we all know it. All of us have lost people, and we’d give anything to have them back, but that… that just isn’t possible, right now. And that’s coming from me.” He paused for a moment, leaning his head against yours. “It’s okay to feel like this. Hell, not a day goes by when there’s not a few moments where I’ll sit in silence and feel exactly like this… but, I’m trying my best. We all are. I know you are, too.”

You nodded against his chest. “I am. But it’s hard.”

“It is. Probably one of the hardest things all of us will ever have to go through. But, as long as we’ve all got each other, that crazy purple psycho can’t hurt us anymore. We’re trying to show him here that what he did isn’t gonna stop us from living. He tried to tear us down, but there isn’t a chance in hell he’ll succeed.” You moved your head to peer up at him, and he smiled. “I’ve got you, you’ve got me… and that’s all that matters. We’re all together.”

It took less than a second for you to mirror his almost melancholy smile, tears pricking at your eyes, but not falling. “I guess so,” you said, and he poked your said.

“Do more than guess, kiddo. The future’s in our hands. We’ll only make it what we’re able to.”

“Tony? Y/N? We’re cutting the cake! Where are you?” Rhodey’s voice carried up the stairs and into the room. Tony glanced briefly at the door before turning back to you.

“We should head back to the party,” you said, and the man leaned down to press a kiss to your forehead, tucking a strand of hair behind your ear.

“Come on, then, you.” He grasped your hand in his and you took a deep breath in before following him in standing to your feet and walking towards the door.

As long as you had each other, he couldn’t hurt you anymore.

If only that had been true.
